heading: kaczynski has his say
subheading: he tells a packed courtroom he's not the vengeful loner that the government claims he is, and says at his sentencing that he'll have a reply to the "false statements" prosecutors released last week.
author: wired news report
text: theodore kaczynski has as standing-room-only proceedings began in a sacramento, california, federal courtroom, kaczynski was asked if he wanted to make a statement, and he took the opportunity to attack a sentencing that memo, kaczynski said, contained "false statements, misleading statements.""by discrediting me personally, they hope to discredit my political ideas," he said, and asked the public "to reserve their judgment about me and the unabom case until i have a chance to respond."he said he would reply to the government filing later, at length.he'll have plenty of time to think about it. as part of the plea bargain that spared him death by lethal injection, he was given four life terms in prison for the mailbombing deaths of three men and the maiming of two others. he'll do his time in a high-security federal prison, possibly in california or colorado.
